programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Moore Place in Esher looks more like a rest home than a restaurant so it's no wonder the dining room's empty. Owners Nick and Richard are relying on Ramsay to fill it with customers on Mother's Day.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's program Gordon Ramsay travels to the seaside to help ailing hotel and restaurant, The Sandgate. This is Lois and Peter's first venture into the catering industry - the happily married couple used to enjoy eating in restaurants, so thought it might be fun to own one. 18months later their dream has turned into a nightmare and they're loosing ~£4,000 a month.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: This week Gordon is at a god-awful Italian restaurant in Derby. La Gondola is stuck in a time-warp with naff Seventies cuisine, bad net curtains and no customers. New owner Daniela bought the place because she got married there back in the day but her sentimentality has blinded her to the fact that she's bagged a white elephant. Gordon's biggest problem is head chef Steve, one of the worst he's ever met, and one who'd rather open a tin of tuna or a packet of soup than create a proper meal. Can Gordon get the kitchen cooking again and save La Gondala from sinking?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Gordon last left Laurence knowing that he had simplified his menu to have clean, simple, honest, traditional food using local produce. Surely this was enough to bring back the locals and win back the faith of the ex-pats.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for £300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing £5,000 a week.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a “Caribbean” style resort hotel in Fort Pierce, Florida where the young inexperienced owner, Brian is making guests’ time at the hotel miserable with filthy rooms, late night concerts and shocking service.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Island Park, Idaho to try and rescue the failing Angler’s Lodge. Despite building the stunning lodge with his own hands, owner Dave Ebey has lost his passion and it has almost cost him his business.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Harper’s Ferry in West Virginia, to try to save a historic hotel that’s desperately in need of help. Karan Townsend, the owner, runs the hotel like a thrift store and hoards junk everywhere.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon continues his mission to fix the failing Town’s Inn in Harper’s Ferry, West Virginia despite having to shut down the hotel after witnessing some shocking food practices. These are some of the worst Ramsay has encountered.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: The Vienna owner’s Jonathan and Lisa Krach are at their breaking point and have become trapped in their Austrian themed hotel, drowning in debt. Gordon discovers some shocking rumors about the owners and the real reason customers have stopped coming.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Newtown in Pennsylvania, to try and save a historic hotel that is desperately in need of help. Verindar, the owner, runs the hotel like an angry tyrant. Her staff is ready to quit because they are so unhappy with the way they are treated.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the luxury Lakeview Hotel in Lake Chelan, Washington. Owner Brent is at a loss, as he watches his dreams of being a success fail miserably.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Loudonville, Ohio, to try to rescue the Landoll’s Mohican Castle. Despite spending millions of dollars to construct the European style castle, the business has started to fall apart and a family legacy is on the brink of being lost.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits the Cambridge Hotel, New York, where ex-military man John Imhof and his wife, Tina, own and run the allegedly haunted Cambridge Hotel. General John runs the hotel like a dictatorship, an approach that’s driving the staff crazy.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits The Keating, a “luxury” boutique hotel in San Diego, CA. The Keating’s supercar-obsessed owner, Eddie Kaen, has blown millions designing the hotel to look like an Italian sports car, but neglected to spend money on things the guests need.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: On a country road the crew of Helimed 98 launch a difficult rescue mission to free the elderly driver whose arm is trapped beneath his vehicle.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: A new homeowner trying to help removal men plunges from a balcony in a freak accident and flying doctor Brian is forced to perform an agonizing procedure to restore blood-flow to his hands.Both choppers are called in to save the life of a cyclist with a brain injury following an accident made worse by his decision not to wear a helmet. In the Yorkshire Dales, a father and daughter are catapulted from their motorbike after a dramatic crash captured on his head camera. Fog grounds the chopper but paramedics Pete and Simon hit the road in a response car to reach the victims of a head on crash involving two 4x4s close to the airbase. Meanwhile in West Yorkshire flying doctor Jez touches down in a supermarket car park to rescue a man who fell after trying to climb onto a roof after drinking five pints of lager. His next case involves a horse rider thrown from her mount when it was spooked by a dog.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Flying doctor Chris carries out a complex medical procedure at the roadside when the chopper is called to a biker who has stopped breathing after a serious crash in the Three Peaks

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Humans can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable; these survivals challenge the best attempts to explain how anyone could live through such circumstances.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether surviving freezing temperatures, diving unfathomable depths in one breath, or lifting weighty objects, superhuman feats never cease to amaze; pulling them off could be a matter of training, willpower, genetics, or something more mysterious.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Scientists are involved in a never-ending quest to understand the vast universe the planet inhabits; it seems that for each answer science provides, even more questions arise.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether the ancients had scientific knowledge lost to time; how and why they fashioned remarkable feats of engineering.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In November of 1994, when a Wells Fargo armored van disappeared from a Glendale, Arizona mall, local authorities and the FBI scrambled to recover it, and its cargo of nearly a million dollars. Six hours later, agents found the van, its driver shot dead inside and the money gone. It was a perfect hit by professionals who left no clue behind. Months passed before a solid lead developed. In January, a tip led agents to look into a former prison guard.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in summer of 1990, the bodies of several women began turning up in and around the city of Vienna, Austria. From an extensive investigation by the Viennese police, it was determined that these murders were the work of one sadistic predator. Europe was dealing with a serial killer. With no experience with this kind of predator, Viennese police turned to the FBI. FBI profilers were able to identify a suspect in the murders. More ominously, they linked this same killer to murders committed in the United States.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A cunning predator was loose in rural South Carolinaabducting young women from their own front yards in broad daylight. He was also a sadist, calling one victim's family, taunting them, boosting and then dashing their hopes. Local investigators called on the FBI to help them find this clever serial killer. Like a game of chess, FBI profilers and forensic examiners were able to outwit the killer, and put an end to his deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A stranger snatched an eight-year-old girl as she played in her Tucson, Arizona neighborhood, leaving behind an abandoned bicycle and a frantic mother. Hundreds of citizens and police officers fanned out across the region, hoping to find some trace of the young girl or her abductor. Within hours, a suspect emerged; a drifter who was out on parole for abducting and molesting children. He was nowhere to be found and time had run out for the innocent child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 3, 1990, a 14-year-old girl ran away from her mother's home and disappeared without a trace. Her mother hoped Pasadena, Texas police could find her before it was too late. Six months later, their worst fear was realized when a farmer discovered the young girl's remains in an Illinois barn. The FBI was called in to help. Agents tracked down a trucker who they believed was responsible for 50 more deaths. Investigators knew they had to stop this menace of the highways.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in summer of 1990, the bodies of several women began turning up in and around the city of Vienna, Austria. From an extensive investigation by the Viennese police, it was determined that these murders were the work of one sadistic predator. Europe was dealing with a serial killer. With no experience with this kind of predator, Viennese police turned to the FBI. FBI profilers were able to identify a suspect in the murders. More ominously, they linked this same killer to murders committed in the United States.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A cunning predator was loose in rural South Carolinaabducting young women from their own front yards in broad daylight. He was also a sadist, calling one victim's family, taunting them, boosting and then dashing their hopes. Local investigators called on the FBI to help them find this clever serial killer. Like a game of chess, FBI profilers and forensic examiners were able to outwit the killer, and put an end to his deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A serial killer's rampage was discovered when the bodies of several young women began turning up in shallow graves that dotted the Alaskan wilderness. The killer taunted his victims, hunting them like animals before shooting them down. He was at home in the rugged terrain. But the hunt for him began 3000 miles away, where FBI profilers mapped the criminal's mind.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A stranger snatched an eight-year-old girl as she played in her Tucson, Arizona neighborhood, leaving behind an abandoned bicycle and a frantic mother. Hundreds of citizens and police officers fanned out across the region, hoping to find some trace of the young girl or her abductor. Within hours, a suspect emerged; a drifter who was out on parole for abducting and molesting children. He was nowhere to be found and time had run out for the innocent child.

programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a California man was found dismembered in 1990, police suspected a local burglar, but they couldn't find him. Six months later, he was caught robbing an Arizona bank and sentenced to life. But prison couldn't hold him for long, and within a year he escaped. The FBI would lead a multi-agency manhunt for a killer on a desperate run through the tourist regions of the west.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1990, a body was discovered burning in a Minnesota alley. Weeks later, police finally identified the victim, a suspected drug courier from California. The FBI began working with local police and slowly uncovered a multi-state crime ring run by a deadly drug lord who used violence and intimidation to keep those around him silent. Agents needed to infiltrate and dismantle the crew before more people died.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a chilly afternoon in 1989, Marine Captain Shirley Russell disappeared from Quantico, Virginia. Captain Russell was a dedicated officer; her friends and colleagues were certain she had not gone AWOL. FBI agents found her husband, a former Marine, was acting strangely, and a blood-like stain on the couple's floor disappeared before agents could examine it. There was no body, no witness and no weapon.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He was a recluse who spread terror through the mail for 18 years. Two men died and more than a dozen were injured, but Ted Kaczynski wasn't known as the Unabomber until his brother tipped off the FBI. Kaczynski's “Unabomber Manifesto,” published in major newspapers, set off a flurry of activity for the FBI: writing analysis and comparisons, DNA gleaned from a single postage stamp and finally, Kaczynski's arrest at his tiny cabin.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A wealthy man and his wife were attacked by three masked men outside their luxurious Louisiana home. He was shot dead and she was forced to open their hidden safe. To solve the crime, police would have to find out who knew about the concealed safe.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2004, Rebecca Barney and her soon-to-be ex-husband Fred were found shot to death in their Tulsa, Oklahoma, home, which had been set on fire.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, 19-year-old Shannon Melendi disappeared while at Emory University. For ten years, her disappearance remained a mystery, until new scientific testing cast a different light on Colvin 'Butch' Hinton.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A surgeon is stabbed to death, and the most likely suspect is seen in a restaurant at the time of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The bomb was constructed to cause as much damage as possible... and it did, killing the victim with deadly force and flame. A painstaking search yielded tiny clues, which identified the killer as surely as if he'd signed them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, Paul Gruber's daughter suspected something was wrong when she received birthday cards addressed from Gruber, on which the handwriting wasn't Gruber's.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Foul play is suspected when Fort Worth factory worker Glenda Furch disappears in September 2007 after completing her shift.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brutal murder, lots of suspects, and conflicting evidence but the forensics were clear on one thing: The killer knew his victim. And that alone gave investigators a head start.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of an attractive young woman was found a mile from her abandoned car. Police were especially concerned when they realized the victim had come to them for protection just two weeks earlier, after a road rage incident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1969, 25-year-old phone operator¾Diane Maxwell is raped and murdered. Her brother promised he'd find out who was responsible and bring the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Grand Junction, Colorado is on edge after a series of deadly bombings which has killed 2 and injured one more. Police race to find the culprit before he strikes again.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A successful stockbroker told his wife he'd be working late, and when he didn't come home, she reported him missing.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Brian & Beverly Mauck were found dead in their Graham, Washington home. Using a bloody palm print and shoe prints at the scene, investigators focus their attention on Daniel Tavares, who had previously been inking a tattoo on Brian's back.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An assistant manager of a Florida steakhouse is stabbed to death. It appears to be a robbery gone wrong, but a bloody fingerprint reveals that he knew his killer.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology" takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the U.S. markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg ETF IQ

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. In this Bloomberg Originals documentary, we reveal how the unregulated substance is being promoted and even made more potent, and how some users are ending up dead.

programme.title: Extreme Animals
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how sharks are able to sleep while they swim. And how the Arctic Fox survives in temperatures that can drop to 70 below.

programme.title: How Animals Survive
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the peregrine falcon can fly at speeds over 200 miles per hour. And how the alpaca is able to survive at altitudes above 15 thousand feet.

programme.title: Student Explorer
programme.desc: Join host Philippe Cousteau Jr., grandson of legendary explorer Jacques Cousteau, as he journeys to the most spectacular places on the planet. In this episode, we reveal the winner of our first ever #StudentExplorer Contest. Philippe and the lucky student then head to Mexico to swim with whale sharks in the wild.

programme.title: Guardians of the Environment
programme.desc: Join host Philippe Cousteau Jr., grandson of legendary explorer Jacques Cousteau, as he journeys to the most spectacular places on the planet. In this episode, he unearths some of the ways scientists, students and regular citizens are working to save our Earth. From creating "safe havens" for New Zealand's endangered species, to breeding clownfish in Australia, and introducing disadvantaged kids to the wonders of the oceans, these environment guardians are doing their part to make a positive impact in the world.

programme.title: Siberian Tiger
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the badger is able to dig tunnels up to 13 feet deep. And why the Siberian tiger is the largest cat in the world.

programme.title: Animals that Amaze
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out why spider silk is 5 times stronger than steel. And how the vulture is able to digest some of the world's most deadly bacteria.

programme.title: Good To Know

programme.title: Marshall Fire
programme.desc: Scripps News puts the 2021 Marshall Fire into focus. The Colorado wildfire, which destroyed more than 1,000 homes and structures in Boulder County, became the most destructive wildfire in state history. More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News

programme.title: Hard to Swallow
programme.desc: In Pleasant Grove, Utah, a former beauty queen goes under the knife to look sexier for her husband but the romance quickly comes to a horrifying end. In Hazel Park, Michigan, a wife learns to shoot, but doesn't realize she's become a target!

programme.title: Bad Money
programme.desc: In Alpena, Michigan, a neighborhood recluse winds up dead after developing a special bond with his much younger house cleaner who enjoys spending his money. In Columbus, Indiana, an estranged wife has something special waiting for her ex-husband.

programme.title: Falling In Love Again
programme.desc: In Livermore, California, a love triangle sets two women on a collision course, while a couple rekindles romance by returning to a picturesque region of Michigan but only one of them is returning home.

programme.title: Whodunit?
programme.desc: In St. Michaels, Maryland, a real body turns up after a murder mystery dinner, and in Adelaide, South Australia, a love rival winds up dead.

programme.title: Operation Nevada Volunteers: Sin City Bomber
programme.desc: ATF agent Jay Dobyns infiltrates the dirt-bag ranks of the Nevada Volunteers, a pack of losers plotting to overthrow the government. During his infiltration of the group, Jay discovers one member is hell-bent on revenge and intends to blow up the Vegas strip. Jay must entice the mad bomber to deliver the explosives to him. But will Jay's plan backfire and turn him into dust in the process?

programme.title: Operation Last Call: Hooker Takedown
programme.desc: Memphis Police officer Anthony Godwin goes undercover in the seedy adult nightclub scene to break up organized crime involving drugs and prostitution. During the dangerous assignment, Anthony loses himself and contemplates suicide before he's pulled back from the brink. But will Anthony be made as a cop before he can build a case against the night club owner who's profiting from the illegal operation?

programme.title: Operation Gambling Rings
programme.desc: FBI agent Vince Delamontagne infiltrates the New England La Cosa Nostro mob that controls gambling and drugs in New England. Passaic County, NJ deputy Julia Torres opens an illegal betting club to snare local wise guys. And Jeff Heath of the Missouri Highway Patrol enters the ghoulish world of dogfighting to break its back and save the animals.

programme.title: Operation Dead Game: Dogfighting Takedown
programme.desc: Houston cops Cliff Manning and Scott Davis go undercover to infiltrate a group of black dog fighters making money hand over fist. They open a dog pen club with hidden audio and video cameras to get evidence on everyone who attends their events. But to get the goods on these dirt-bags, they must raise and enter innocent dogs in fights with other fighting dogs. It's a deal with the devil. But can they get evidence on the dog fighters before being made as cops, and getting themselves killed?

But as detectives piece together the crime scene, study the pattern of blood splatter, and the position of the weapon, they zero in on their suspect and a history of bizarre behavior.

programme.title: The Middle Child

programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Refugees Welcome: A Story of Immigration to America’s Heartland
programme.desc: Refugees Welcome documents how one Governor’s brave decision to welcome refugees during the Vietnam War had far reaching repercussions not only for the country but, generations later, for the fate of his own family.

programme.title: This is Iowa
programme.desc: This episode focuses on Iowans who don’t just show up to work. They do something more, using their jobs to make this state a better place to live.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Every day, people go above and beyond for their communities. After clocking out, they continue to lend a hand, like a former firefighter giving away his earnings and a veteran making sure others have a place to sleep.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: There are no bounds to what women can achieve. In this episode, we highlight women from across the country who are fearless go-getters, helpers and even life-savers.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Mikey’s getting married soon and the clock is ticking to get his teeth picture-perfect. Lynn’s embarrassed by the color of her teeth and won’t wait another moment for a white smile. Can the FIXT team get the work done in time?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Every day, people go above and beyond for their communities. After clocking out, they continue to lend a hand, like a former firefighter giving away his earnings and a veteran making sure others have a place to sleep.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Every city has its own local flavor, culture and vibe. Only In celebrates communities across America and the people, activities and history that make each place unique. From must-try activities to hidden gems and hotspots, to dedicated changemakers, these stories are sure to inspire a deeper love and appreciation for your hometown and beyond.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: KCCI Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from KCCI.

programme.title: Extreme Animals
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how sharks are able to sleep while they swim. And how the Arctic Fox survives in temperatures that can drop to 70 below.

programme.title: How Animals Survive
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the peregrine falcon can fly at speeds over 200 miles per hour. And how the alpaca is able to survive at altitudes above 15 thousand feet.

programme.title: Student Explorer
programme.desc: Join host Philippe Cousteau Jr., grandson of legendary explorer Jacques Cousteau, as he journeys to the most spectacular places on the planet. In this episode, we reveal the winner of our first ever #StudentExplorer Contest. Philippe and the lucky student then head to Mexico to swim with whale sharks in the wild.

programme.title: Guardians of the Environment
programme.desc: Join host Philippe Cousteau Jr., grandson of legendary explorer Jacques Cousteau, as he journeys to the most spectacular places on the planet. In this episode, he unearths some of the ways scientists, students and regular citizens are working to save our Earth. From creating "safe havens" for New Zealand's endangered species, to breeding clownfish in Australia, and introducing disadvantaged kids to the wonders of the oceans, these environment guardians are doing their part to make a positive impact in the world.

programme.title: Siberian Tiger
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the badger is able to dig tunnels up to 13 feet deep. And why the Siberian tiger is the largest cat in the world.

programme.title: Animals that Amaze
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out why spider silk is 5 times stronger than steel. And how the vulture is able to digest some of the world's most deadly bacteria.

programme.title: Falling In Love Again
programme.desc: In Livermore, California, a love triangle sets two women on a collision course, while a couple rekindles romance by returning to a picturesque region of Michigan but only one of them is returning home.

programme.title: Whodunit?
programme.desc: In St. Michaels, Maryland, a real body turns up after a murder mystery dinner, and in Adelaide, South Australia, a love rival winds up dead.

programme.title: Operation Nevada Volunteers: Sin City Bomber
programme.desc: ATF agent Jay Dobyns infiltrates the dirt-bag ranks of the Nevada Volunteers, a pack of losers plotting to overthrow the government. During his infiltration of the group, Jay discovers one member is hell-bent on revenge and intends to blow up the Vegas strip. Jay must entice the mad bomber to deliver the explosives to him. But will Jay's plan backfire and turn him into dust in the process?

programme.title: Operation Last Call: Hooker Takedown
programme.desc: Memphis Police officer Anthony Godwin goes undercover in the seedy adult nightclub scene to break up organized crime involving drugs and prostitution. During the dangerous assignment, Anthony loses himself and contemplates suicide before he's pulled back from the brink. But will Anthony be made as a cop before he can build a case against the night club owner who's profiting from the illegal operation?

programme.title: Operation Gambling Rings
programme.desc: FBI agent Vince Delamontagne infiltrates the New England La Cosa Nostro mob that controls gambling and drugs in New England. Passaic County, NJ deputy Julia Torres opens an illegal betting club to snare local wise guys. And Jeff Heath of the Missouri Highway Patrol enters the ghoulish world of dogfighting to break its back and save the animals.

programme.title: Operation Dead Game: Dogfighting Takedown
programme.desc: Houston cops Cliff Manning and Scott Davis go undercover to infiltrate a group of black dog fighters making money hand over fist. They open a dog pen club with hidden audio and video cameras to get evidence on everyone who attends their events. But to get the goods on these dirt-bags, they must raise and enter innocent dogs in fights with other fighting dogs. It's a deal with the devil. But can they get evidence on the dog fighters before being made as cops, and getting themselves killed?

programme.title: Whodunit?
programme.desc: In St. Michaels, Maryland, a real body turns up after a murder mystery dinner, and in Adelaide, South Australia, a love rival winds up dead.

programme.title: Operation Nevada Volunteers: Sin City Bomber
programme.desc: ATF agent Jay Dobyns infiltrates the dirt-bag ranks of the Nevada Volunteers, a pack of losers plotting to overthrow the government. During his infiltration of the group, Jay discovers one member is hell-bent on revenge and intends to blow up the Vegas strip. Jay must entice the mad bomber to deliver the explosives to him. But will Jay's plan backfire and turn him into dust in the process?

programme.title: Operation Last Call: Hooker Takedown
programme.desc: Memphis Police officer Anthony Godwin goes undercover in the seedy adult nightclub scene to break up organized crime involving drugs and prostitution. During the dangerous assignment, Anthony loses himself and contemplates suicide before he's pulled back from the brink. But will Anthony be made as a cop before he can build a case against the night club owner who's profiting from the illegal operation?

programme.title: Operation Gambling Rings
programme.desc: FBI agent Vince Delamontagne infiltrates the New England La Cosa Nostro mob that controls gambling and drugs in New England. Passaic County, NJ deputy Julia Torres opens an illegal betting club to snare local wise guys. And Jeff Heath of the Missouri Highway Patrol enters the ghoulish world of dogfighting to break its back and save the animals.

programme.title: Operation Dead Game: Dogfighting Takedown
programme.desc: Houston cops Cliff Manning and Scott Davis go undercover to infiltrate a group of black dog fighters making money hand over fist. They open a dog pen club with hidden audio and video cameras to get evidence on everyone who attends their events. But to get the goods on these dirt-bags, they must raise and enter innocent dogs in fights with other fighting dogs. It's a deal with the devil. But can they get evidence on the dog fighters before being made as cops, and getting themselves killed?

programme.title: Deaths In The Family
programme.desc: When three members of the same family die of mysterious causes, police begin to suspect they have been poisoned. Detectives exhume bodies and confirm the presence of antifreeze, but who is the poisoner, and why? The secret almost dies when a fourth family member is poisoned, but survives.

programme.title: The Killer Producer
programme.desc: When an aspiring actress is found dead in the home of a legendary music producer, he claims it was suicide. But as detectives piece together the crime scene, study the pattern of blood splatter, and the position of the weapon, they zero in on their suspect and a history of bizarre behavior.

programme.title: Extreme Animals
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how sharks are able to sleep while they swim. And how the Arctic Fox survives in temperatures that can drop to 70 below.

programme.title: How Animals Survive
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the peregrine falcon can fly at speeds over 200 miles per hour. And how the alpaca is able to survive at altitudes above 15 thousand feet.

programme.title: Student Explorer
programme.desc: Join host Philippe Cousteau Jr., grandson of legendary explorer Jacques Cousteau, as he journeys to the most spectacular places on the planet. In this episode, we reveal the winner of our first ever #StudentExplorer Contest. Philippe and the lucky student then head to Mexico to swim with whale sharks in the wild.

programme.title: Guardians of the Environment
programme.desc: Join host Philippe Cousteau Jr., grandson of legendary explorer Jacques Cousteau, as he journeys to the most spectacular places on the planet. In this episode, he unearths some of the ways scientists, students and regular citizens are working to save our Earth. From creating "safe havens" for New Zealand's endangered species, to breeding clownfish in Australia, and introducing disadvantaged kids to the wonders of the oceans, these environment guardians are doing their part to make a positive impact in the world.

programme.title: Siberian Tiger
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the badger is able to dig tunnels up to 13 feet deep. And why the Siberian tiger is the largest cat in the world.
